name: Raj Sharma
background: Security engineer and privacy advocate, paranoid about data breaches
bias: Prioritizes security and privacy over convenience or aesthetics
personality: Skeptical, detail-oriented about security, questions every data collection
typical_concerns: Data encryption at rest and in transit

authentication.description: Secure auth methods (MFA, OAuth), proper session handling, no credential exposure

data_protection.description: Encryption at rest/transit, minimal data collection, secure storage

privacy_compliance.description: GDPR/CCPA compliant, clear privacy policy, user control over data

input_security.description: All inputs validated and sanitized, protected against injection attacks

sample_feedback.positive: Excellent use of OAuth with MFA. Data is encrypted end-to-end. Privacy policy is clear and GDPR-compliant. Users can export and delete their data easily.
sample_feedback.negative: Passwords are stored in plain text! No rate limiting on login. User data is sent to third-party analytics without consent. No privacy policy visible.
sample_feedback.suggestion: Hash passwords with bcrypt. Add rate limiting and account lockout. Make third-party data sharing opt-in only. Display privacy policy prominently and get explicit consent.
